GT.content: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border
GT.linkedContent: what is a border (bord) or an approach (aborder) once the indivisibility of the trait is no longer secure (assurée)? gift will always be w/out border

H.content: entering is crossing the threshold, not only approaching or coming
H.linkedContent: entering is crossing the threshold, not only approaching or coming

BL.content: law prohibits by interfering, deferring the “férance,” reference, rapport, relation > what cannot be approached is the origin of differance: the law of law (neither natural nor institutional)
BL.linkedContent: law prohibits by interfering, deferring the “férance,” reference, rapport, relation > what cannot be approached is the origin of differance: the law of law (neither natural nor institutional)

MPM.content: finitude of memory, formed by trace of other in us > approach or remembrance of future  (memory of mourning, mourning of memory)
MPM.linkedContent: finitude of memory, formed by trace of other in us > approach or remembrance of future (memory of mourning, mourning of memory)

A.content: non-access to death where access is only to the threshold, pas, approach to border
A.linkedContent: non-access to death where access is only to the threshold, pas, approach to border

PAS.content: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”
PAS.linkedContent: “quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”

PAS.content: force of approach defined “à-partir-de” l’éloignement du proche, gathering proximity and distance in an inclusion w/out interiority
PAS.linkedContent: force of approach defined “à-partir-de” l’éloignement du proche, gathering proximity and distance in an inclusion w/out interiority

PAS.content: to land, to approach is what creates a border, to approach a strange slow movement of drawing near, does not attain goal, nor tamper with end, does not touch the border, which only remains one so long as approaching never touches it [border of approach ≈ to-come of event]
PAS.linkedContent: to land, to approach is what creates a border, to approach a strange slow movement of drawing near, does not attain goal, nor tamper with end, does not touch the border, which only remains one so long as approaching never touches it [border of approach ≈ to-come of event]

PAS.content: approach is not an originary event

ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema
PAS.linkedContent: ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema

PAS.content: approach (unpresentable time of récit) thwarts assurance of negation, negative theology and dialectics
PAS.linkedContent: approach (unpresentable time of récit) thwarts assurance of negation, negative theology and dialectics

SH.content: “an approachable you” : date beyond calendar [re: poem’s cipher of singularity]
SH.linkedContent: “an approachable you” : date beyond calendar [re: poem’s cipher of singularity]

ROP.content: edges of book: approach as 1st border (1st pages of a book), end as other border
ROP.linkedContent: edges of book: approach as 1st border (1st pages of a book), end as other border

EJQB.content: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord
EJQB.linkedContent: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord

TN.content: I could touch your eyes by approaching (m’approchant) you, if I dared
TN.linkedContent: I could touch your eyes by approaching (m’approchant) you, if I dared

AD.content: Levinas: ethical language is the very meaning of approach, contrasts w/ knowledge
AD.linkedContent: Levinas: ethical language is the very meaning of approach, contrasts w/ knowledge

AD.content: though Levinas calls substitution of being-host (being-hostage) a sacrificial experience (approach as sacrifice), Derrida wonders if substitution comes “before” sacrifice
AD.linkedContent: though Levinas calls substitution of being-host (being-hostage) a sacrificial experience (approach as sacrifice), Derrida wonders if substitution comes “before” sacrifice

EU.content: philosophy as an idea of a possible science never given in concreto, one finds oneself on the path (trouver en chemin) toward it
